DOC.brief_summary: This study recruit 480 acute stroke patient symptomatic intracranial stenosis ( M1 segment Middle cerebral artery ( MCA ) basilar artery ) . They randomly assign cilostazol group clopidogrel group . Every patient take 100mg aspirin day additionally . The primary outcome variable study Progression rate symptomatic intracranial stenosis magnetic resonance angiogram ( MRA ) .
DOC.brief_title: Trial Cilostazol Symptomatic Intracranial Arterial Stenosis II
DOC.detailed_description: [ Goal ] To Reveal Effect Safety Cilostazol Compared Clopidogrel Prevention Progression Symptomatic Intracranial Arterial Stenosis . [ Trial Design ] Double-Blind , Active-Controlled , Randomized , Multicenter Trial [ Participants ] Acute ischemic stroke patient symptomatic intracranial arterial stenosis [ Methods ] - Double-Blind , Active-Controlled , Randomized , Multicenter Trial - Investigational product ( Double Dummy Method ) : Cilostazol 200mg ( 100mg twice per day ) versus clopidogrel 75mg - Concomitant medication : Aspirin 100 ( 75-150 ) mg per day - Medication Duration : 7 month [ Outcome Variables ] Primary Outcome Variable : - Progression rate symptomatic intracranial arterial stenosis Secondary outcome variable : - The occurrence new MRI ( magnetic resonance image ) lesion follow-up MRI - Stroke event - Overall cardiovascular event : stroke , acute coronary syndrome , vascular death - Ipsilateral ischemic stroke rate - Fatal major bleeding complication
